p: The US CDC developed a tetravalent chimeric dengue vaccine by splicing the prM and E genes of attenuated DENV-1, -3, and -4 into NS RNA of the successfully attenuated DENV-2 16681 PDK-53. The tetravalent vaccine candidate has undergone preclinical testing in mice and nonhuman primates comparing intradermal and subcutaneous routes of delivery. The intradermal delivery of a tetravalent preparation of DENVax (10 5 Â pfu per DENV-type) produced superior immune responses in cynamolgous monkeys ( Osorio et al., 2011a, Osorio et al., 2011b).
